when_to_say: Used in Lesson 1 for various scenarios.
example: ありがとう、手伝ってくれて！ (arigatou, tetsudatte kurete!) - Thank you for helping me!

when_to_say: Used in Lesson 2 for various scenarios.
example: おはよう、元気？ (ohayou, genki?) - Good morning, how are you?

when_to_say: Used in Lesson 3 for various scenarios.
example: さようなら、また明日！ (sayounara, mata ashita!) - Goodbye, see you tomorrow!

when_to_say: Used in Lesson 4 for various scenarios.
example: すみません、道を教えてもらえますか？ (sumimasen, michi wo oshiete moraemasu ka?) - Excuse me, can you tell me the way?

when_to_say: Used in Lesson 5 for various scenarios.
example: お元気ですか？ (ogenki desu ka?) - How are you?

when_to_say: Used in Lesson 6 for various scenarios.
example: こんにちは！今日は良い天気ですね。(konnichiwa! kyou wa ii tenki desu ne.) - Hello! It’s nice weather today.

when_to_say: Used in Lesson 7 for various scenarios.
example: お願いします！手伝っていただけますか？ (onegai shimasu! tetsudatte itadakemasu ka?) - Please! Can you help me?

when_to_say: Used in Lesson 8 for various scenarios.
example: おめでとう、合格しましたね！ (omedetou, goukaku shimashita ne!) - Congratulations, you passed!

when_to_say: Used in Lesson 9 for various scenarios.
example: この絵、すごいですね！ (kono e, sugoi desu ne!) - This painting is amazing!

when_to_say: Used in Lesson 10 for various scenarios.
example: この猫、かわいいですね！ (kono neko, kawaii desu ne!) - This cat is cute!

example: この猫、かわいいですね！ (kono neko, kawaii desu ne!) - This cat is cute!

when_to_say: Used in Lesson 1 for various scenarios.
example: ありがとう、手伝ってくれて！ (arigatou, tetsudatte kurete!) - Thank you for helping me!

when_to_say: Used in Lesson 2 for various scenarios.
example: おはよう、元気？ (ohayou, genki?) - Good morning, how are you?

when_to_say: Used in Lesson 3 for various scenarios.
example: さようなら、また明日！ (sayounara, mata ashita!) - Goodbye, see you tomorrow!

when_to_say: Used in Lesson 4 for various scenarios.
example: すみません、道を教えてもらえますか？ (sumimasen, michi wo oshiete moraemasu ka?) - Excuse me, can you tell me the way?

when_to_say: Used in Lesson 5 for various scenarios.
example: お元気ですか？ (ogenki desu ka?) - How are you?

when_to_say: Used in Lesson 6 for various scenarios.
example: こんにちは！今日は良い天気ですね。(konnichiwa! kyou wa ii tenki desu ne.) - Hello! It’s nice weather today.

when_to_say: Used in Lesson 7 for various scenarios.
example: お願いします！手伝っていただけますか？ (onegai shimasu! tetsudatte itadakemasu ka?) - Please! Can you help me?

when_to_say: Used in Lesson 8 for various scenarios.
example: おめでとう、合格しましたね！ (omedetou, goukaku shimashita ne!) - Congratulations, you passed!
